newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Britain tried to turn Hong Kong independent - paper.
newsitem.headline: Britain tried to turn Hong Kong independent - paper.

text.p: A senior Chinese official said Britain had once considered turning Hong Kong into an independent state to prevent Beijing from retaking the colony, a Taipei-based newspaper said on Monday.

"They (Britain) had discussed how to not return Hong Kong to China, and one way was to hold a plebiscite to turn Hong Kong into a Singapore," Zhou Nan, the Hong Kong director of China's official Xinhua news agency, told Taiwan's China Times daily.
Singapore won full independence and became a republic in 1965.
Zhou, who attended Sino-British talks on the Hong Kong handover issue between 1982 and 1984, did not elaborate on his remarks.

His comments marked the first time a senior Chinese official had confirmed widespread speculation by Hong Kong newspapers that Beijing had suspected a Britain-engineered separatist plot for Hong Kong.
Zhou said Britain was unwilling to hand Hong Kong back to China, and had tried to nullify the previously signed retrocession pact during its negotiations with Beijing.

"British negotiators told (late paramount leader) Deng Xiaoping that a disastrous consequence would occur if Britain did not administer Hong Kong, but Comrade Deng did not buy into this," Zhou told the newspaper.
China is set to regain sovereignty over Hong Kong at midnight on June 30, ending 156 years of British rule.
"When the sovereignty issue is involved, China would never compromise," Zhou said.
Xinhua is China's highest representative office in Hong Kong.
